summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for July 26, 2019. The logs show staff signatures confirming inmate observations at irregular intervals, as per protocol for inmates in locked-down status. The sheets are reviewed by watch lieutenants and a captain.

persons.name: MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT
persons.context: The officer responsible for reviewing and signing off on the 30-minute check sheets for the morning watch shift.

persons.name: DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT
persons.context: The officer responsible for the day watch shift operations, as indicated on the check sheet headers.

persons.name: EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT
persons.context: The officer responsible for the evening watch shift operations, as indicated on the check sheet headers.

persons.name: CAPTAIN
persons.context: The senior officer who reviewed the completed check sheets, as noted at the bottom of each log.

events.title: SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute observational checks of inmates held in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The documents are 30-minute check sheets for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The date of the logs is July 26, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.
The logs document a standard procedure where staff must observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed by watch lieutenants (Morning, Day, Evening) and a Captain.
The documents are administrative prison logs showing routine inmate monitoring protocol.
